title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1261.22 - Landing of aircraft without two-way radio restricted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1261.22 - Landing of aircraft without two-way radio restricted

State Regulations

No aircraft may land or take-off at an air terminal
without prior permission unless it is equipped with a functioning radio capable
of direct two-way communication with the control tower, except in case of
emergency. In addition, no aircraft may land or take-off at La Guardia Airport
unless it is equipped with a functioning radio capable of direct two-way
communication on the VHF frequency designated as ground control, except in the
case of an emergency. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1261.22

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
